originalText: ferryman
Start Element
ferryman

::Todd cautiously boards the ferry, scanning the vastness around him. The Ferryman's intimidating visage softens ever so slightly, and he reaches out for a handshake. Todd reciprocates with surprisingly little hesitation, although he can't help but gawk at everything, be it something on this scrap-littered deck or far beyond.::

::A ferry rests lightly on the water, gently swaying from left to right. On its deck - a man, old in appearance, but appearance only. He is walking up and down the deck busily, moving and sorting some kind of scavenged junk and at the same time displaying swiftness and strength rarely seen in people of his age. And everywhere he goes he is being followed by a trail of smoke born of his pipe.::

Who goes there?

::He says just before introducing you to his shotgun.::

::He speaks through the smoke.::

I see you've started opening them, I do.
::You find the ferryman busy as always.::
context.npc_xpbl_ferryman_movingOut
We're
I'm

::You've already told him in advance all he needs to know, so you simply stand aside for a while and let the two men get familiar with each other. Few words are exchanged but many glances and gestures, some directed your way: To these you respond with a nod or two, or in Todd's case - a gesture of encouragement.

Soon, Todd is inspecting and moving stuff around the deck, and it was time for you to leave.::
context.npc_xpbl_ferryman_acceptedTodd
Outta my boat, kid. You and I got nothing to talk about anymore.

You again. ::He points his shotgun at you.::

You really wanna get your head blown clean off, don't ya?
The lighthouse. Its luminescence... captivating, ain't it?
context.npc_xpbl_ferryman_timesMentionedRuins
::Todd doesn't seem to be lagging far behind either.::
moving out, kid. Talking's over.
context.npc_xpbl_as_todd_finalDestination
ferryman
context.npc_xpbl_ferryman_movingOutDelay
Take it easy. I just want to talk.
::[Intelligence]:: A... potential pellet recipient?
Invictus!
Your euthanizer, old man. ::Attack!::
Um... sorry for bothering you. I'll get going.

All this destruction... ::He sighs and shakes his head.:: 

Such a waste of life.
Welcome back, kid.
I guess I could use a break. What do you need this time?
You again.
xpbl_g1

::Smoke erupts toward you, but not from the barrel of his shotgun; it obscures the lower part of his face, everything below the nose except for the lit end of his pipe; above, his eyes still stare at you.::
Those who are witty at gunpoint have stared down plenty a gun barrels. Both as friends and foes.
Are you threatening me, kid? On *my* boat?
Invictus? ::He pauses.:: Why would a person like you choose the deadly waters of the Black Sea over bathing in fame and wealth?
That's what they all say...
Who. Goes. There?
::[Persuade]:: I'm terribly sorry about what happened earlier, I really am. I'd like for us to start anew.
I won't disturb you. Goodbye.
English
Gimme your best shot, old man. ::Attack!::
So... what's inside?
I know.

::He lowers his gun and grabs his pipe with his left hand. The glow in the pipe intensifies while the glow in his eyes subsides. His smile is slight, but he is quick to wipe it off his face.

::
Which one are you?
You betcha.
::Attack!::
Start anew, eh?
I sense no remorse in your words.
Show me what you got. ::Barter.::
Have you ever seen anything like this? ::Show him the ACoNR.::
How's Todd doing?
I've found the last living Lemurian.
Every time we mention the ruins you'd start silently staring into the water.
I'd like to discuss the Descent into Center with you.
English
About that Descent into Center of yours...
What do you do with the more interesting things you find, like artifacts and various other oddities? Are you willing to trade them too?
I heard you possess an unusual object that somewhat resembles the monolith.
English
Where did you say you hit Sjoersr with the shard?
English
Where did you say you hit Sjörsr with the shard?
There was something you wanted to say when we talked about the monolith.
Tell me about Hank Wardell.
Who are you?
Can I ask you a few personal questions?
I had some questions about the Black Sea.
I'd like to know more about some of the factions here.
Can you mark for me the locations you frequently visit on this device?
Where are you headed to next?
This crane of yours...
English
About lifting heavy things...
Hey, do you have some kind of a two-way radio on the boat?
Do you have any spare tobacco? Or cigarettes or cigars?
I'm off. See you some other time.
What do you want?
Let's talk then.

Fine, fine. I won't blow your head clean off. But I'm not interested in talking to you either: I gotta move out soon. However... I got some scavenged material - if you're interested in a trade; that much time I do have. ::He nods.:: That much time I do have.
You got guts, kid, I'll give you that. But I got a shotgun, and as long as we're on my boat I get to keep it pointed at whomever I want. Now... why did you come here?
Get outta here or I'll blow your head clean off.
Talk, you say? Well... they all just wanna talk...
Why did you come to me?
Perhaps... But why did you come to me?
Very well. ::He nods.:: Let us start anew. ::He still keeps his shotgun pointed at you.::
You go sell that third-rate crap to someone else, kid. Don't sell it to me.
Death.
Not much. Ruins be ruins.

::He gazes at it ponderously, then looks at you.::

No. No, I haven't.

::With growing discomfort, he continues after a brief pause.:: What is it?
::He puffs smoke.:: He's a troubled man from a different place, different culture, a man who holds values incompatible with this state of the world.
::His eyes broaden.:: Lemurian?
What is that supposed to mean?
Fine.
::He takes a draw.::
You think you can handle something which could change your whole perspective on life, existence... reality itself?
No.
::He nods.::
Who told you that?
In the $(GiantSkerderHitBodyPart_DisplayName). The $(GiantSkerderHitBodyPart_DisplayName).
English
::He stares at you.::
English

A while ago, fourteen years or so I think... ::He takes a long, steady draw.:: ...yes, when a thing came into my possession. This little... object that resembled... 

It may be better to say looked - looked - like it came from the monolith.

Hank was an older gentleman, not as old as myself but most certainly a man who has spent his years acquiring knowledge and building up great wisdom; this made him catch up or even surpass me in this regard. He strove for the optimum, and that is the aspect of him I admired and found fascinating the most. The way he thought of and did things...
I'm a ferryman.
English
Very well. Ask away.
Forget about it, kid.
Sure.
What makes you think I'd answer your questions?
Then ask.
English
Sure.
Then ask.

::He looks at the navcom as if you handed him a dead rat.::

Mmm. What do I do?
I'll be hitting $(context.npc_xpbl_ferryman_firstNextLocation) first, and after that probably $(context.npc_xpbl_ferryman_secondNextLocation). That's the plan. ::He blows some smoke.::
Doesn't concern you.
Mhm. ::He looks up towards it...:: What about it? ::...and lowers his head.::
English
Need something, kid?
English
Yeah?
English
What about that?
Yes.
No.
Tobacco is hard to come by down here in the South; much too few hydroponic farms down here. The few sources I have are irregular, to say the least. I've got nothing to spare, kid.
See ya, kid.
Mhm. ::He nods.::
::He returns to his routine without saying a word.::
I'll take a look at what you got. But first tell me where to find you. Maybe next time you'll feel a bit more talkative.
English
For your head. ::Attack!::
What else... ::He shakes his head.::
Really... like what?
Ruins, eh. What did you find?
There's only one way to find out.
It's my business as much as it's yours, no?
Don't treat me like a bag of guano, kid. I'll blow your head clean off.
xpbl_g1
context.global_xpbl_acorn_gaveTo
plot.xpbl_acorn
English
I don't know much about it myself, but from my understanding it's a highly valuable piece of technology.
English
All I know is that it's somehow connected to certain high-tech machines capable of traversing great distances, even reaching the Surface.
English
It seems to be a device capable of manufacturing highly advanced things, like objects and machinery.
English
It's a device capable of utilizing materials from its surroundings in order to construct complex objects and machinery.
English
It's a supercomputer capable of controlling nanobots that can use materials from their surroundings to construct complex objects and machinery.
English
Never mind, actually. There was something else I wanted to ask you.
He's in a better place now. A *higher* place, kid. ::He looks at him and puffs smoke.:: He'll do well. He'll do well.
We get along fine.
context.npc_xpbl_as_todd_finalDestination
submarine
From an abyssal station at the bottom of the sea.
Yup. There's still one around. Picked him up from an abyssal station at the bottom of the sea.
context.npc_xpbl_ferryman_timesMentionedRuins

::He walks to the cabin, pouring the ash from his pipe into the sea along the way. There he kneels - effortlessly at his age - beside the bed and grabs a small plastic box from underneath it. It is a simple dark-brown box with a worn-out label: In it - another pipe, superficially similar to the one he has been smoking up until now but with a rougher texture and more prominent signs of age; inside is also a nylon bag filled with what appears to be tobacco.::
Excellent.
Very good.
Why are you interested in such things?
::He blows some smoke upward and takes a deep, calm breath.::
I don't have it anymore. It's gone.
Eustace, the mutie.
Donnie Merchant.
::He puffs smoke.::
Nothing, kid, nothing. ::He takes a long draw and exhales slowly, staring in the monolith's direction.::

I got it from a pirate... ::He puffs smoke.:: The name eludes me, but he was a member of the pirate crew that lived at Port Ceto long before the Jetters came in. I traded it for something I scavenged.

::He pauses.:: Due to the circumstance he was in at the time, I can't tell you a whole lot about him. I'm obliged to discretion, you see; even mentioning his name was, perhaps, a bit of an oversight on my part. But that doesn't matter anymore, no. ::He puffs smoke and stares into the distance.:: Still, him and I, we had a great discussion - debate - regarding the Descent into Center. Agreements on certain topics solidified our beliefs, while disagreements forced us to think hard in order to refute each other's arguments; and arguments were indeed strong - some I haven't been able to refute to this day. To this day...
Ain't it obvious?

::He looks at you, moves his pipe from one end of his mouth to the other and speaks.::

You really wanna know more about me?
English
One question. You got one question.
There's nothing to talk about.
That's the plan, kid.
There you have it.
::He puffs smoke.::
Mind giving me the frequency in case I need to contact you about something?
Is there some other way I can communicate with you?

::He pauses, glancing at the sea before looking back at you.:: Donnie Merchant of the Grim Jetters has a cigar or two occassionally, but I'm pretty sure... pretty sure he keeps those for special customers only.

::He draws another smoke from his pipe and unleashes it upward.::

You know what? You newcomers really are a persistent bunch. I might actually need to start dispensing hot lead if I am to keep you at bay.
I hope we don't. And tell that to your newcomer friends as well. The next one of you to come to me might just get some extra lead in his system.

::He smirks at your remark.::

Keep away from my boat, scum. And tell your friends they'll eat lead if they bother me again.
What? Didn't catch that.
Yes, they're tombs alright. But tombs have treasure. What's inside?
One way to find out, kid.
It doesn't matter anyway. It's all gonna turn out the same...
Now get off my boat. Talkin's over.
Hm. I see.
::He shakes his head..::
Wait. Wait.
Hmm. *The submarine*.
But where is he?
Who do you think you are, kid?
Tell you?
An observation?
Why...!

::After sprinkling the said tobacco into his pipe, dosing it carefully until satisfied, he uses a tamper - a pen-shaped tool with a wide flat head - to gently compress it. He then repeats the process two more times before putting the pipe tool away. He takes a draw, not yet lighting his pipe, and returns all of the items but the pipe back into the box, which he also returns to its original location. He walks back to you, stroking his yellowish mustache with his left hand, eyes glued to the rusty deck. 

The Ferryman then pulls out a lighter...::
But ultimately, I do not collect them. I
::[Intelligence]:: I feel I can learn a lot by studying the cultural remains of people that lived before us.
::He puffs smoke, keeping his eyes on you.::
He said he got it from a man who... got it from some other man who had apparently found it and claimed it came from the dreaded Glowing Canine.

He may have been the best conversational partner I have ever had.

I often wonder how *my* arguments are holding up after these few years since our encounter. ::He exhales a column of smoke and lets his mind wander off.::
What's your real name?
Why are you here?
What can you tell me about your boat?
How old are you?
Do you have anyone? Family, friends? Or are you completely alone here?
How come everyone leaves you alone? Especially the natives. They don't seem to like anyone.
You already asked your question.
What can you tell me about the local wildlife?
I'm interested in the general geography of this place.
This place seems to have very rich and diverse flora. Where do I look for some of the more useful species of plants and fungus?
How much do you know about the history of this place, about the NFT facilities?
English
How much do you know about the history of this ruined place?
Tell me about the geysers.
What can you tell me about the Fetid Marsh?
Sørmirbæren territory, what can you tell me about it?
English
Sourmirbaren territory, what can you tell me about it?
Where exactly is The Pirate Bay?
The monolith at the entrance to the Black Sea, what do you know about it?
Really?
::He chuckles.::

It is...

Ask.
context.npc_xpbl_ferryman_questions_topic
factions
What are the Black Sea factions?
About the Grim Jetters...
English
About the Sourmirbaren...
English
About the Sørmirbæren...
I'm interested in learning more about the natives.
The pirates. Tell me about them.
What can you tell me about the muties?
What do you know about the expedition?
What's your opinion on Aegis Incorporated?

Hm. ::He squints, holding the navcom at an arm's length, and then starts tapping the screen.::

Muties... Port Ceto... northeastern waters... geyser village...

::He shows you the display.:: That it?
Yes. And generally lifting stuff in and out of the boat.
I need some naval mines moved to the expedition camp.
English
About those naval mines...
I need a submarine moved to a certain location.
English
The submarine...
I'll keep that in mind.
::He nods.:: Fine, fine. Just let me check...
Yes. I mind.
I don't want anyone bothering me.

::He slowly exhales smoke through his nostrils.::

Fine.
I don't know where I'll be next time. If you need my help that much, find me. Or don't. ::He blows some smoke right beside your face.::
Art. ::He chuckles.::
Technology.
History... ::He chuckles.::
Mankind's favorite. So that we may further cull each other.
Animals. Which you killed, I presume? At least those that wouldn't move out of the way.
Ah, machines - technology.

::He takes a long draw, blows smoke and continues without looking at you.::

So what do you want this time?
Why did you bring this... box to me?
$(context.playerArenaTitle).
The Invictus.
A sec-trooper.
A Free Drone.
An Underrail Protectorate corporal.
A Tchortist.
A Grim Jetter.

Descent into Center, you say? ::He says and lights his pipe, puffing a few times until it's properly lit. Then he takes a long first draw and expels a thick cloud of smoke that has a unique, full-bodied musty smell evocative of memories of an unexperienced past.::

Mmmmmmm... ::He takes a moment to relax, to stare at the relatively calm sea; then he looks you dead-straight in the eye.::

We can begin, kid.
The Center...
True Death...
Burden...
Ascension...
We'll see...
Let us see, then...
::He puffs smoke.:: As you wish, kid. Maybe you're better off.

pass them on. ::He puffs smoke.:: There is no other way but to pass them on, kid. I do, however, make sure to give them to someone who will be... enriched by it, even if just a little. 

Enriched - in the real sense of the word.
With that I agree, kid, with that I agree wholeheartedly.
Collecting is qualitative; hoarding is compulsory and quantitative. And in our perception the line between the two is often blurry.

But will the people be able to understand and appreciate them? If people see no value in what you give them, they'll let it go to waste or even intentionally destroy it, in case it challenges or goes against their fundamental beliefs.
Quantity. Mere quantity. ::He shakes his head.::

That is good if true. And don't misinterpret that as an implication of dishonesty, but rather of whether you care out of true understanding as opposed to merely finding the superficialities... ::He puffs smoke.:: amusing.
No.
::He blows smoke right in your face.::
You know, it happened a long time ago. Fourteen years or so, I think. Yes. That's when I got this... object.
I thought it looked interesting. Very unusual, very.
$(context.npc_xpbl_ferryman_realName)
I'm... searching.

This boat's older than I am. In fact, it is so old it's been modified so many times one can hardly think of it as being the same boat; yet somehow, in essence, it is still the same one. It had, for instance, an internal combustion engine - diesel-powered - before it was converted to electric. Two and a half thousand kilowatts of power - like that of a tugboat.
Seventy.
Family - no. Friends... I have people I cooperate with: muties, pirates... even the Sørmirbæren. People know me and I know them, and with most I am on very good terms.
I cooperate with everyone - sometimes even with the Sørmirbæren. I've been around for a long time, kid, long time. I know them well enough.
::He responds after a pause.::
::He chuckles.:: You got that right.

First and foremost - serpents. There are several species of them in the Black Sea, but not a single one would hesitate for a second to devour you. They will even attack large vessels such as mine, so I always have a shotgun loaded with nothing smaller than boarshot with me at all times.
There is only one thing you need to know...
There's a lot one can say about this place. A lot.

The vegetation is not here by mere chance. No, no. It's been cultivated by the former inhabitants of the Black Sea. ::He stares into the sea, appearing as though he's looking straight through the surface.:: They may have met their doom, but they did leave some life behind to flourish on its own.

There is a variety of species here. The most abundant are by far the water reeds, but there ain't much you can extract from them. The honey stalks fruits contain useful chemicals and are also deceitfully tempting to eat, and you'd resist that urge if you value your life. ::He takes a draw and exhales smoke.:: Green warts too.
Little.
They're in the northeastern corner of the Black Sea; that's the basalt region. You'll know you're near when the ground turns all muddy and covered with lumps of salt.

The Marsh covers the eastern area of the Black Sea, situated inside a basalt cave system and is a breeding nest of locusts, serpents and other things. ::He puffs smoke.:: The pirates go there to hunt and collect various ingredients, the Sørmirbæren as well.
English
Hmmm! You got the pronunciation right, kid, got it right.

The northern part of the sea, land, water and air, all of it has been claimed by the Sørmirbæren, all of it. From the western caves to the geysers to the east - and everything in between, kid.

And they guard it with unyielding fervor.
Southeast of here,
English
South of here,

It's known as the Glowing Canine among the people. ::He puffs smoke.:: I've only ever seen it from below, but those who have been there and returned alive said its peculiarity is not limited to its physical appearance, for the psychological influence it imposes upon those who approach it is more than evident. Some sought more from it, but those did not retain their sanity or - in better case - did not survive. No, no...
Natives, pirates, a community of muties
They are no more, kid.
::He chuckles.:: You should know all you need to by now, kid.
What about them?
::He nods.::
Hmmm! You got the pronunciation right, kid, got it right.
The Sørmirbæren... ::He puffs smoke.::
The Grim Jetters.
::He takes a deep breath. ::
Your mates know more than me. The two weeks since it all started have been rough for the Jetters... since Aegis Incorporated came here.
::He inspects you.:: Hmm.
They came here about two weeks ago, this... Aegis Incorporated.
::He shakes his head.::

The crane is technically overpowered for this boat, as I don't have enough counterweight to use it to its full potential. Regardless of that, lifting a... let's say... ::He looks at the crane and slightly tilts his head from left to right a couple of times.:: ...ten to fifteen tonne load is generally safe if it's done close to the boat.
Live mines?
Seven hundred charons.
A thousand charons.
A submarine? ::He pauses before proceeding calmly.:: The one at the geyser facility?
Where do you need it moved?
Don't get any ideas. ::He puffs smoke.::

::He walks to his cabin and pulls out a radio station from underneath his bed. He blows away the thick coating of dust from this primitive sturdy box before swiping some more from a microphone and a bent antenna which he promptly bends back to approximate straightness. 

He switches the radio on, turns a few knobs, then returns to you.::
Why not?
Well now... here's what I've scavenged just before you came.
Well now... shouldn't you be leaving?
Unnecessary... ::He chuckles.:: Enough fooling around.

The world don't care about Art anymore, kid. Don't care. Art requires culture, and culture is in short supply. What we get now is mostly the perversion of Art, barring a few exceptions popping up from time to time. The art of Art has been lost a long time ago.

Most people wouldn't recognize it if you shoved it in their face.
::He shakes his head.:: You think more technology is gonna help this world, eh?

Do you think we would be here if people cared about history? They care only - *only* if it's aligned with their worldview, otherwise it gets tossed into the ocean like a torn rag or distorted to such extremes that it had better been tossed.

And besides, even if they did care about it, most can't learn anything from it anyway.
Typical. ::He chuckles.:: Typical...

The last Lemurian...

::He puffs smoke high up, his gaze clinging to the stalactites above before dropping it down..::

Why me, kid?
::He chuckles.:: Lost.
Your title is meaningless.
You are lost.
Oh, you think so?
What I'm about to tell you are my own thoughts, observations, ideas - my own philosophy, which I based on years and years of study and experience. ::He puffs some more smoke.::
The Spirit of Gravity: True Death's call. Everything that exists heeds this call. Everything that lives must grow old and heavy, and eventually die.
Origin: The highest point of existence, free of all the hardships. Complete weightlessness.
Where True Death awaits.
This is too complex for you to understand right now.
Passage of time is but an illusion, a way in which we perceive the directional nature of Reality.
True Death is... the ultimate death. The permanent death.
The weight which we carry on our backs and the one we carry *within* - this burden, it makes us sink to the Center.
If we are lighter than Existence... we Ascend.
::He nods and puffs smoke.::

::He ponders for a moment.:: Very well. I will show you some of the things I've found. The price I ask for them does not reflect their qualitative value, mind you, for that would be pointless. No, I'm merely covering my expenses.
I do not collect these... relics I find, I
::He looks at you briefly.::
I don't sell 'em, kid. ::He puffs smoke.:: I do not.
Careful...
You call me a liar one more time and you're outta my ferry.

But I don't go by that name anymore. A name is not something used merely to identify you but rather define you - it's something you should live up to. And my former name is unbefitting of the life I currently live and have lived for many years. 

Now I am... just Ferryman.
For what?
There goes my question...

It's got its share of problems due to its age. ::He looks at the crane.:: But the crane, it never failed me. No matter the depth, no matter the weight - it retrieves. ::He takes a draw from his pipe, holding it with his right hand before unleashing a curtain of smoke.::

It retrieves.
Exactly seventy years old.
But friends in a traditional sense? No.
And I know what I need to do to be left alone.

Then you got crabs - some hide in the sand, some in anything they can fit in. The spiders - they dwell in secluded caves and their venom causes blindness. Locusts - just stay away from their massive hives, and the Fetid Marsh in general.
Everything here is out to get you, everything. The solution is either to leave the Black Sea or to grow extra pairs of eyes and ears. ::He draws on his pipe and exhales soon after.::
In general:
But I'm not willing to talk about it at length, so I'll keep it brief:
These can be found all over the cavern but are most abundant in the more dangerous places like the Fetid Marsh and the surrounding areas - all Sørmirbæren territories.

::He stares into the sea, appearing as though he's looking straight through the surface.::

And it doesn't matter, anyway.

Much like the rest of the Black Sea, it ain't a hospitable area. The steam gushing out of the hot springs can cause blisters at great distances, and the only terrestrial residents there are crabs which have adapted to such extreme heat.

Those who have gone deep into the Marsh and made it back in one piece spoke about seeing broken-down mining equipment, machinery... and carts containing ore of various shades of green.

Stone... green stone.
beyond the walls of Port Ceto.
::He opens his mouth to speak but stops.::
::He makes a long pause...::
and as of recently that damn expedition.
It's just a matter of time before new ones come.
::He puffs smoke.::
They are no more, no more, kid. They were sad creatures emburdened by one of the worst things science and "logic" have produced.

Not much to say about them. Sad creatures emburdened by one of the worst things science and "logic" have produced. Their perseverance, be it driven by reason, hope or impulse alone, is something deserving of great respect.
That's what they're called. ::He puffs smoke.:: Got into trouble with the Jetters right away, and of course with the natives - the Sørmirbæren. Of course.
Fools. Dead fools.
::He shakes his head.:: My eyes and screens don't really get along, kid. Haven't for a long time. ::He puffs smoke.::
What's the heaviest thing it can lift?
Can it lift a submarine?
player
expedition_security
context.npc_xpbl_ferryman_coinsForMines
That'll cost you seven hundred charons.
Yeah. ::He puffs smoke.::
The frequency's 22.787 megahertz. Again: 22.787 megahertz.
::Barter.::

::[Persuade]:: You want nothing to do with us and that is understandable. But we're not leaving until we're done here, so the sooner we do that the sooner you're going to see our backs. So please, would you mind postponing your next trip just a little bit and answering a few of my questions?
Goodbye.

::He stares into the sea, appearing as though he's looking straight through the surface.:: 

Descent...
Nothing, hm.
Good. 'Cause
A wise man once told me that you can help yourself by helping someone else with their burden.
But... in the grand scheme of things, so am I. You, me... the rest of Underrail. The poor suckers who lived here and whose skulls now serve as insect and fish homes and for coral to grow on.

I looked within myself and the surrounding world, its history and culture - and lack thereof; I've read the Old books and books older still, and I studied and compared their contents in an attempt to extrapolate the ultimate truth. This is what I inferred: This *Reality* of ours stretches in a certain direction, drawn by something I refer to as the *Spirit of Gravity*. This direction leads to *True Death*.
I don't think you've fully grasped some of the more basic concepts yet.
English
In fact, our

You know, I haven't discussed the Descent into Center with anyone since Hank... ::He pauses.:: Hank... Wardell, was it? 

Yes, yes... *Wardell*.
